problem: The math class in Think Academy starts at $9:00$ and ends at $10:00$. How long does the whole class last?

One morning, Sara goes out to exercise. At $$\rm 6.30$$ a.m., Sara leaves home and jogs at a speed of $$8$$ km per hour. At $$\rm 8.30 $$ a.m., she feels a little bit tired and walks at half her jogging speed. At $$\rm 9.30$$ a.m., Sara ends her exercise. How many kilometres has Sara travelled during her exercise?

Danny needs $$12$$ minutes to take the stairs from the first floor to the fourth floor at a constant speed. At this speed, how long does he need to take the stairs from the first floor to the second floor?

In a class, the average height of the girls was $163\text{cm}$. Teacher Yun accidentally recorded one of the girls\textquotesingle{} height as $126\text{cm}$ instead of $162\text{cm}$. Therefore, the average height of the girls was inaccurately recorded as $159\text{cm}$ instead. How many girls\textquotesingle{} heights were recorded?~\uline{~~~~~~~~~~}~girls

Jamie has $3$ ribbons, which are $$56$$cm, $$42$$cm and $84$cm long respectively. He cuts them into smaller portions of equal lengths, with no remainders left from any ribbon. What is the greatest possible length of each portion?
An insect measures 5 cm in length. A snake measures 1 m in length. How many times smaller is the insect than the snake?
Katie had $$2.3\text{kg}$$ of bread. She gave away $$0.76\text{kg}$$ of it to her neighbour. What is the mass of the bread that she had left? Round off your answer to $$1$$ decimal place.

$4$ people are standing by a river. There is only $1$ boat, and it can only seat $2$ people at one time. The $4$ of them take $7$ minutes, $9$ minutes, $4$ minutes and $10$ minutes respectively to row the boat across the river. What is the shortest period of time they will take to cross the river?

Maria can cover a certain distance at her usual speed in $30$ minutes. After running for a period of time, it rains, so she reduces her speed by $$20 \%$$ and continues to run for $$2400$$ metres. She arrives at her destination $$5$$ minutes late. Find the length of the journey.
At $5.00$ am the temperature is $- 3$℃. At $10.30$ am the temperature has risen steadily by $2$℃ per hour. What is the temperature at $10.30$ am?

Jayden starts from place A, and Carter starts from place B. They walk towards each other at the same time. The speeds ratio of Jayden to Carter is $7:4$. After Jayden arrives to place A, he turns around immediately and keep walking until he meet Carter. If the distance between place A and place B is $440\rm m$, how far is their meeting place from place A?
One-fifth of the length of a piece of wood measures 6cm. What is one-third of this wood?

It takes $10$ minutes to fill a bath when using both the hot and cold tap at the same time.  Water flows from the cold tap at twice the rate of the hot tap.  How long would it take to fill the bath when using just the cold tap?

At Think Olympics, Jack completes an $$800-$$meter race. He runs the first $$280$$ meters at a speed of $$7$$ meters per second, the middle $$400$$ meters at a speed of $$5$$ meters per second, and in the sprint stage, Jack runs at a speed of $$8$$ meters per second. Find the time Jack spends on the entire race (in seconds).
The ratio of Jocye\textquotesingle s speed to Lori\textquotesingle s speed is $3:2$. If Lori can run $2$ meters per second, how far can Jocye run in $10$ seconds?

Don walks towards the library at a speed of $$60$$ metres per minute. His brother, Danny, returns from the library at the same time. They meet $$360$$ metres from their house. How fast can Danny walk if the library is $$780$$ metres away from home?
Anne mixed $1$ kg $500$ g of flour, $1$ kg $200$ g of brown sugar and $900$g of butter in a bowl. She then divided the mixture equally into $8$ cake tins. How much mixture was there in each cake tin?

Nicolas and Yiding are climbing the stairs with different speed. They both start from level $$1$$. When Nicolas reached level $$4$$, Yiding reached level $$3$$. Continue with this speed, when Nicolas reach level $$16$$, Yiding will be at which level?

The coldest temperature ever recorded on earth (at Vostok station in Antarctica) is $$-89^{}\circ\text{C}$$.  The hottest temperature ever recorded (it was somewhere in Libya) is $$58^{}\circ\text{C}$$.  By how many degrees Celcius is the \textquotesingle hottest hot\textquotesingle{} greater than the \textquotesingle coldest cold\textquotesingle?  Answer :~\uline{~~~~~~~~~~}~$$^{}\circ\text{C}$$

Every morning, Star goes out to exercise. At $$\rm 6:30$$ a.m., Star leaves home and jogs at a speed of $$6.5$$ miles per hour. At $$\rm 7:30 $$ a.m., Star feels a little bit tired and walks at a speed of $$4.5$$ miles per hour. At $$\rm 9:30$$ a.m., Star finishes her exercise. How many miles does Star travel in total every morning?
What is $$9$$ metres in centimetres?  ~\uline{~~~~~~~~~~}~centimetres

A snail is climbing a clock tower which is 45 metres high.~ It climbs up 10 metres during the day and slides down during the night. 1 metre on the 1st night, 2 metres on the 2nd night,~ 3 metres on the 3rd night, $\cdots$ and so on. Which day would reach the top of the tower?
A model village is made to a scale of $$2\text{ cm}$$ to every $$3$$ metres.  A real tree is $$12\text{ m}$$ tall.  What is the height of the model tree?

There were some lamp posts placed at regular intervals along a $50$m road. Jamie planted $3$ flowers between every $2$ lamp posts. If he planted $30$ flowers in total, what was the distance between every $2$ lamp posts?
What temperature is $17^{\circ}\text{C}$~less than $8^{\circ}\text{C}$?
A tree is planted at every $$10$$ metres along a stretch of road. If the stretch of road is $$150\text{m}$$ long and the trees are planted at opposite ends of the road, how many trees are there?

There is a square lawn with a side length of $12$ metres. Some rosebushes are planted inside the edge of the garden. Each bush is to be planted $1.5 $ metres from the edge of the garden, and $3$ metres from its neighbouring rosebushes. How many rosebushes are required to complete this in total?

Two vans travel from the same place but in the opposite directions. The faster van travels at $$132 \text{km}$$ per hour, the other van at $$78 \text{km}$$ per hour. How far apart are the two cars after $$8$$ hours?~\uline{~~~~~~~~~~}~km.
Jasmin can ride a bike at a constant speed of $36$ meters per minute. How many meters can she ride in $200$ seconds?

David walks in the park at a speed of $$150$$m per minute. Ten minutes later, he increases his speed by $$50$$m per minute and walks for a while before returning home. David walks a total of $$3700$$m today. How long has David spent walking in the park?
Write down a number that is half-way between $-18$ and $-2$
The ratio of height to width on an old television screen is $$3:4$$.  If the height of a television screen was $$21\text{cm}$$, find the perimeter of the screen.
Nick and Tom cut pieces of string. Nick's string is $$25\text{cm}$$ longer than Tom's. Tom's string is $$13\text{cm}$$ long. What is the difference in length between their pieces of string?

A vegetable plot is $20$ metres long. Cauliflowers are planted in a row down the length of the plot. They are planted $40  \text{cm}$~apart and the first cauliflower is planted $20  \text{cm}$~from the end. How many cauliflowers can be planted in a row?
Add together $3.7$~metres and$ 64 \rm cm $ and then subtract $2$~metres $7\text{c}m$. Give your answer in metres.
Change $$4.6$$ minutes into seconds.  Answer~\uline{~~~~~~~~~~}~

Think Academy is organising a Sport Day. Teacher Nicole wants to place the flag along the field. She needs to make sure that the flag are place in a consistant distance between $$2$$ flags. Lucy is curious about the distance between $$2$$ flags. Techer Nicole tells her that the distance between the 1\textsuperscript{st} and 4\textsuperscript{th} flag is $$9\text{m}$$. What is the distance between the 1\textsuperscript{st} and 9\textsuperscript{th} flag?

John buys a Pikachu model, which is $$19.6\textasciitilde\text{cm}$$ height. Mike buys another Pikachu model with different height. The ratio of John\textquotesingle s model height to Mike\textquotesingle s model height is $$2:3$$. What is the height of Mike\textquotesingle s Pikachu model?
A ship travels at a speed of $$22$$ km/h in still water. The speed of the current is $$3$$ km/h. How long will it take the ship to travel $$200$$ km downstream?
In the decimal part of $$0.\dot{8}527\overset{\centerdot }{\mathop{4}} ,$$, what is the $79\text{th}$ digit?

Sam wants to place a fence all around his garden, which is shaped like a rectangle. The garden is 5m long and 3 m wide. What is the total length of fence that Sam will need to place around his garden?
A ship travels at a speed of $$88$$ km/h in still water. The speed of the current is $$12$$ km/h. How long will it take the ship to travel $$500$$ km downstream?
\textbf{$$n$$~}is the number of seconds in two and a half minutes.  \textbf{$$n=$$~\uline{~~~~~~~~~~}~}

Alan and Phillip start at the same time and walk from $A$ to $B$. It takes Phillip $12$ minutes to arrive at $B$. Phillip walks $15$ meters more than Alan does per minute. Given that Phillip arrives at $B$ $3$ minutes earlier than Alan does, find the distance between $A$ and $B$.

There are $$9$$ benches in the park, which have the same length. They are placed on one side of the road every $$7$$ meters from end to end. Given that the length of the road is $$74$$ meters, how long is the bench?
The distance from the $1$\textsuperscript{st}~tree to the $5$\textsuperscript{th}~tree is $20$ cm. What is the distance from the $8$\textsuperscript{th}~tree to the $14$\textsuperscript{th}tree?
Jasmin can ride a bike at a constant speed of $60$ meters per minute. How many meters can she ride in $150$ seconds?

Jennifer is assembling a wardrobe. The measurements for the $3$ sections are given in different units. The first section is $30$cm wide; the second section is $1.5$m wide and the third section $150$mm wide. How wide is the whole wardrobe? Give your answer in cm.
Katy is going to the cinema to see a fifilm that starts at $$3.25$$pm and lasts $$108$$ minutes.  At what time will the fifilm end?  Write your answer using the $$24$$-hour clock.
Find the $$2023^{\text{th}}$$ digit in the number  $$12345678910111213\cdots 998999$$.

Linda and Ted started jogging from two ends of a path towards each other at the same time. When Linda passed Ted, Linda had jogged $$1200\rm m$$. If the speed ratio of Linda to Ted is $3:4$, what was the length of the path?
Calculate $25 \%$ of~$64  \text{kg}$
Natalie arrived at her friend\textquotesingle s birthday party at $$11.40$$ a.m.  She stayed there for $$4$$ hours and $$50$$ minutes. What time did Natalie leave the party?

There was $$448\text{g}$$ more mangoes than strawberries. After $$900\text{g}$$ of mangoes were given away, the mass of strawberries was twice as much as the mass of mangoes. What was the mass of strawberries at first?
William jogs at $$2$$ metres per second. How far does he jog in $$12$$ minutes?

Xavier has $100$ grams of a solution with a sugar concentration of $25 \%$, Yelena has $500$ grams of a solution with a sugar concentration of $55 \%$ and Carol has $400$ grams of a solution with a sugar concentration of $35 \%$. If they mixed the solutions together, what is the concentration of the resulting sugar solution?
Mike travels from his home to office at $3$ km/h and reaches his office $12$ min late. If his speed was $5$ km/h he would have reached $4$ min early. Find the distance from his home to office.
Last night the temperature was $$-8^{}\circ\text{C}$$ but today it is $$13^{}\circ\text{C}$$. By how much has the temperature gone up?  Answer:~\uline{~~~~~~~~~~}~$$^{}\circ\text{C}$$
Two iron bars, $$23$$-$$\text{cm}$$ and $$37$$-$$\text{cm}$$-long, have been welded into one single piece. If the welded part has a length of $$3\text{cm}$$, how long is the full piece?
What is the difference between the hottest and coldest of these temperatures?  $-10º\text{C}          16º\text{C}          9º\text{C}          2º\text{C}$

A prism with a square base of side length $5\text{cm}$ has a $1\text{cm}\times1\text{cm}$ square hole cut through vertically. If the volume of the prism is $480\text{cm}^{3}$, what is the height of the prism?

Amy and Christen started driving from two places at the same time, going towards each other. Amy\textquotesingle s speed is $$60$$ miles per hour and Christen\textquotesingle s speed is $$40$$ miles per hour. They meet after $$4$$ hours. How long does it take for Christen to reach Amy\textquotesingle s starting point?

When Maverick started cycling from his home, Kelvin was $$10$$ $$\rm km$$ ahead. Maverick\textquotesingle s cycling speed was $$15$$ $$\rm {km/h}$$ and Kelvin\textquotesingle s cycling speed was $$10$$ $$\rm {km/h}$$. They went in the same direction and did not change their speeds throughout.  Maverick was certain that he took only $$24\rm min$$ to catch up with Kelvin, but Kelvin was certain that Maverick took longer.  Who was correct? If Kelvin was correct, how long did Maverick take to catch up to Kelvin?

$$41$$ plum trees are planted along a stretch of road with trees planted at opposite ends of the road. The distance between each tree is $$4\text{m}$$. On the opposite side of the road, pine trees are planted at regular intervals of $$5\text{m}$$, with trees planted at opposite ends of the road. How many pine trees are there on this side of the road?

One day morning, Susan goes out to exercise. At $$\rm 7:30$$ a.m., Susan leaves home and jogs at a speed of $$5$$ miles per hour. At $$\rm 8:30 $$ a.m., Susan feels a little bit tired and walks at a speed of $$3$$ miles per hour. At $$\rm 10:30$$ a.m., Susan finishes her exercise. How many miles does Susan travel in total this morning?
$$21$$ trees are to be planted along a road $$800$$ $$\text{m}$$ long at regular intervals. If both ends of the road are planted with trees as well, how far is one tree from another?
Two buildings are $$90\textasciitilde\text{m}$$ apart from each other. $$9$$ trees are planted at regular intervals between the two buildings. What is the distance between each tree?
Emma needs $$12$$ minutes to cut a piece of wood into $$4$$ sections. If her cutting speed remains unchanged, she needs~\uline{~~~~~~~~~~}~minutes to cut the piece of wood $$5$$ times.

There are some lamp posts along a street at equal distances apart. The distance between the $$1$$st and the $$6$$th lamp post is $$60\textasciitilde\text{m}$$. What is the distance between the $$1$$st and the $$9$$th lamp post?
A worm is staying at the bottom of a well with a depth of $$8$$ metres. If it climbs up $$3$$ metres in the daytime and slips down $$2$$ metres at night, which day will it climb up to the ground?
The sugar content of a $$900\text{ml}$$ bottle of rose syrup is $$6 \%$$. How much sugar must be added to the bottle such that the sugar content becomes $$10 \%$$?
Gary has a piece of rope that is 2 m 20 cm long. He cuts it into two equal pieces. How long is each piece? Write your answer in cm.
A train with a length of $$200$$ $$\text{m}$$ is moving at a speed of $$60$$ $$\text{m/s}$$. Find how long it takes for the end of the train to cross a bridge with a length of $$220$$ $$\text{m}$$.

The wet market is $48 \rm m$ from Auntie Lina\textquotesingle s house.  Auntie Lina can walk $8 \rm m$ in one minute.  How many minutes does it take her to reach the wet market?  Aunt Lina thinks that she just need \textbf{$$5$$} minutes. Her working is done below:     Minutes took===\textgreater$$48\div 8 = 5$$     Is she correct? If she is wrong, write the correct answer.
At midday in Moscow the temperature is $4$$^{\circ}\text{C}$. By midnight the temperature has dropped by $11$$^{\circ}\text{C}$. what is the temperature at midnight?

Tina started her trip from city $$A$$. She went east for $$15\text{km}$$, then went north for $$3 \text{km}$$. After that she went west for $$9\text{km}$$. Finally, she went north for $$5 \text{km}$$ to end her trip at city $$B$$. What is the shortest distance, in $$\text{km}$$, from city $$A$$ to city $$B$$?

Eureka Primary School is having their Sports Day. Each activity is $$45$$-minute long, and there is a $$20$$-minute break between each activity. The entire duration of Sports Day, from the start of the first activity to the end of the last activity, is $$8$$ hours and $$20$$ minutes. How many activities are there in Sports Day?

Adam, Ben and Carl are weighing themselves.  Together, Adam and Ben weigh $$102\text{kg}$$  Ben and Carl weigh $$97\text{kg}$$  Adam and Carl weigh $$92\text{kg}$$  What is their total weight in $$\text{kg}$$?  Answer~\uline{~~~~~~~~~~}~
An icicle measured $2.06\text{m}$~at the start of a sunny day, but only $78\text{cm}$~at theend of the day. What length of icicle had melted?

The Road Authority decided to use a new system on traffic lights. The traffic lights are arranged such that $3$ traffic lights turn green at the same time every $9$ minutes. The first traffic light changes lights every minute and the second traffic light changes lights every $1.5$ minutes. Determine the shortest possible time the third traffic light takes to change lights, considering that it should be at least $30$ seconds or longer.

There are three pieces of ribbon.  The pink ribbon is $2.5$ metres long, the blue ribbon is $220$ centimetres long and the orange ribbon is $30.5$ centimetres long.  Which ribbon is the longest?  ~\uline{~~~~~~~~~~}~

Sara is preparing a dish. It costs $10$ minutes for preparing ingredients, $15$ minutes for baking the dish, $5$ minutes for washing the plate, and $15$ minutes for eating. At least, it will take~\uline{~~~~~~~~~~}~minutes for Sara to finish the dish.

Eleanor was travelling from City F to City G at a uniform speed. She drove past Rachel who was travelling at a uniform speed of $84 \text{km/h}$ in the opposite direction. One and a half hours later, Eleanor reached City G while Rachel was still $39 \text{km}$ away from City F. If Eleanor took $4$ hours to travel from City F to City G, what was the distance between the two cities?
Ribbon A is $3$ times as long as Rope B. Rope C is $56$ cm longer than Rope B. If Rope A is $1$ m $30$ cm longer than Rope C, find the total length of the three ropes.~\uline{~~~~~~~~~~}~cm.

200 litres ($$\text{L}$$) of a punch bowl that contains $$35 \%$$ fruit juice is mixed with $$300$$ litres of another punch bowl that contains $$50 \%$$ fruit juice. Find the percentage concentration of the new mixture.

Neither of the two photocopiers in our office works very well.  Photocopier $$\text{A}$$ produces $$1$$ \textquotesingle bad\textquotesingle{} copy for every $$4$$ \textquotesingle good\textquotesingle{} ones.  Photocopier $$\text{B}$$ produces $$1$$ \textquotesingle bad\textquotesingle{} copy for every $$5$$ \textquotesingle good\textquotesingle{} ones.  We need to produce $$600$$ \textquotesingle good\textquotesingle{} copies of a poster.  $$\frac{3}{5}$$ of the \textquotesingle good\textquotesingle{} copies will be produced by Photocopier $$\text{A}$$.  $$\frac{2}{5}$$ of the \textquotesingle good\textquotesingle{} copies will be produced by Photocopier $$\text{B}$$.  How many copies in total (including the \textquotesingle bad\textquotesingle{} ones) will be needed?

Annie has $300$ grams of a solution with a sugar concentration of $15 \%$, Becky has $400$ grams of a solution with a sugar concentration of $25 \%$ and Carol has $300$ grams of a solution with a sugar concentration of $35 \%$. They mixed the solutions together. What is the concentration of the resulting sugar solution?
A ball is dropped from a height of $10{\rm{m}}$. It bounces off the floor to half its original height. How far, in total, will the ball have travelled when it reaches the floor for a second time?
$$\approx $$ means approximately equal to. Given that $$1$$ kilogram ($$\text{kg}$$)$$\approx $$$$2.2$$ pounds ($$\text{lb}$$), convert $$154\text{lb}$$ to $$\text{kg}$$.
Elena is $$500$$ metres behind her cat. Elena can run at $$8$$ m/s and her cat can only run at $$3$$ m/s. How long does Elena take to catch up with her cat?

A photocopier can finish copying a document at speed of $50$ pages per minute. Speed up the rate of the photocopier by $ 20$ more pages per minute, he will finish the job in $2$ minutes less. How many pages are there in the document?

Every morning, Star goes out to exercise. At $$\rm 6:30$$ a.m., Star leaves home and jogs at a speed of $$6$$ miles per hour. At $$\rm 7:30 $$ a.m., Star feels a little bit tired and walks at a speed of $$5$$ miles per hour. At $$\rm 9:30$$ a.m., Star finishes her exercise. How many miles does Star travel in total every morning?

A long distance calling plan charges $80$ cents for any call up to $15$ minutes long and $5$ cents for each additional minute. If it takes Ryan a total of $1.4$ dollars, how many minutes does the call last?
A roll of cloth is $11$m $74$ cm long. $5$m $8$cm is cut from it to make a dress and the remainder is cut into $9$ equal stripes. What is the length of each stripe of cloth?
Japan time is $$7$$ hours ahead of France. Amy started her flight from Japan to France at $$8$$pm of $$2$$nd July and arrived France at $$1$$am of $$3$$rd July. How long did the flight take?

There are two containers, $$A$$ and $$B$$. Container $$A$$ has $$50\text{g}$$ of water with $$10 \%$$ concentration of sugar. Container $$B$$ has $$30\text{g}$$ of water with $$20 \%$$ concentration of sugar.  The same volume of sugar solution is removed from each container and transferred between the two containers, resulting in the concentration of sugar in both containers to become the same.  Find the volume of sugar solution transferred in grams.
Katie needs $$8$$ minutes to cut a piece of wood into $$5$$ sections.  If her cutting speed remains the same, she needs~\uline{~~~~~~~~~~}~minutes to cut the piece of wood $$6$$ times.
A recipe for making tarts needs $$40\text{g}$$ of flour and $$80\text{ml}$$ of milk.  If Tom only has $$25\text{g}$$ of flour then how much milk will he have to use?

Every Saturday, Ellen visits her friend in the town nearby. At $7 : 30$ a.m., Ellen leaves home and rides a bike to the train station at a speed of $10$ miles per hour. At $8:30$ a.m., Ellen arrives at the train station and gets on a train that travels at a speed of $50$ miles per hour. At $10:30$ a.m., Ellen arrives in the town. How many miles does Ellen travel in total every Saturday?

A car departed $9$ minutes later than the scheduled time. In order to reach its destination on time, it has to increase its speed by $30 \%$. If the usual speed of the car is $60$ mph, how far does this car have to travel to reach its destination?

If a cyclist increases his speed by $25 \%$, the time taken for him to cover a certain distance will decrease by $20$ minutes. If the cyclist decreases his speed by $45$ metres per minute, the time taken for him to cover the same certain distance will increase by $75 \%$. Find the distance he has to travel.
The difference between the smallest factor and greatest factor of $$A$$ is $$41$$. What is the $$7^{th}$$ multiple of $$A$$?~\uline{~~~~~~~~~~}~
The ratio of height to width on an old television screen is $$3:4$$.  If the height of a television screen was $$21\text{cm}$$, find the perimeter of the screen.
Find the remainder of $\underbrace{333\ldots333}_{{12  \text{digits} }}\div7$.
Lisa was baking bread in the oven. The bread got into the oven at $10:30$. When she took the bread out of the oven, it was $11:00$. How long did it take to bake the bread in the oven?

David walks in the park at a speed of $$150$$ metres per minute. Ten minutes later, he increases his speed by $$50$$ metres per minute and walks for a while. David walks a total of $$3700$$ metres today. How long has David spent walking today?~\uline{~~~~~~~~~~}~minutes

Singapore time is $$7$$ $$\text{hours}$$ ahead of London time. $$A$$ plane took off from Singapore at $$05:00$$ and flew to London. When it landed in London, the clock there showed $$11:00$$. How long did the flight take?

There are two ropes, rope A and rope B. Rope A is $$65$$ metres long and Rope B is $$29$$ metres long. After Noa cuts an equal part from both rope A and rope B, the length of rope A is $$3$$ times that of rope B. What is the length of the part that has been cut from rope A and rope B?
If you increase the length of a rectangle by $12\rm{cm}$, you will get a rectangle with a perimeter of $38\rm{cm}$. What is the perimeter of the original rectangle?
It takes Uncle Sam $$50$$ seconds to cycle from the first lamp post to the eleventh lamp post. How many lamp posts will he cycle past after $$80$$ seconds?

At Windy Valley Primary School, the basketball court is $$25$$ $$\text{m}$$ long.  The football field is $$56$$ $$\text{m}$$ longer than the basketball court.  What is the length of the football field?  The length of the football field is~\uline{~~~~~~~~~~}~$$\text{m}$$.
(Maths Olympiad 《Simple Speed》 Pr$$1$$\&$$2$$ Question \#$$9$$）  Auntie Lina takes $$3$$ minutes to cook $$2$$ pancakes.  How many pancakes can she cook in $$12$$ minutes?
A man takes $$2 $$ minutes to cut a metal rod up into two pieces. How many minutes will he take to cut a metal rod of the same length into $$5$$ pieces?

Jeffrey needs $$6$$ minutes to walk up the stairs from the first floor to the fourth floor at a constant speed.  At this speed, how long does he need to walk up the stairs from the first floor to the tenth floor?

At Think Olympics, Jack completes an $$800-$$meter race. He runs the first $$280$$ meters at a speed of $$7$$ meters per second, the middle $$400$$ meters at a speed of $$5$$ meters per second, and in the sprint stage, Jack runs at a speed of $$8$$ meters per second. Find the time Jack spends on the entire race (in seconds).
There are two pieces of rope. The short rope is $$20$$ meters long. The length of the long rope is $$5$$ times that of the short rope. How many meters are the two pieces of rope?

A van travels at $$80\text{km}$$ per hour to another city. $$3$$ hours later, a car travels at $$120\text{km}$$ per hour towards the same city from the same place. In how many hours can the car catch up with the van?     Below is Mason\textquotesingle s answer.  $120-80=40$  $120\div40 = 3$  The car can catch up with the van in $3$ hours.     Is Mason\textquotesingle s answer correct? If not, what is the correct answer?

Printer $A$ can print $300$ pages in $12$ minutes while Printer $B$ can print $300$ pages in $10$ minutes. If both printers are used at the same time, how many pages can they print in $\frac{1}{2}\text{h}$?

$$A, B, C$$ and $$D$$ live in the same block of apartment that has $$18$$ level. Their name are Zachary, Yvonne, Xavier and Waylon.  We know that:  (1) $$A$$ stays in an unit that located higher than $$C$$, but lower than $$D$$  (2) $$B$$ stays in an unit that is lower than Xavier\textquotesingle s unit  (3) $$D$$ stays in an unit that is $$5$$ times Yvonne\textquotesingle s unit  (4) If Zachary moves to two level above his unit, the difference in level between his unit and Xavier\textquotesingle s unit is equal to the difference of his unit with Waylon\textquotesingle s unit.  (5) The level that Zachary stays is the sum of the level Yvonne and Xavier stay.  Based on the information above, do you know who is which level does $$A$$ stays in?
Amy mixed $$100$$ pounds of dogfood that is $$50 \%$$ rice with $$400$$ pounds of dogfood that is $$80 \%$$ rice. Find the concentration of rice in the new mixture.
Jasmin can ride a bike at a constant speed of $24$ meters per minute. How many meters can she ride in $300$ seconds?

A box is projected up a long ramp (incline angle with the horizontal = 37°) with an initial speed of 10 m/s. If the surface of the ramp is very smooth (essentially frictionless), how high up the ramp will the box go? What distance along the ramp will it slide?
How many centimetres are there in $4.7$ kilometres?

Two drivers, Shafur and Samuel left Town $$X$$ for Town $$Y$$ at the same time. They drove at an average speed of $$54 \text {km/h}$$ and $$66 \text {km/h}$$ respectively. After they drove for $$40$$ minutes, Samuel decided to turn back to Town $$X$$ to refill the petrol while Shafur continued driving at the same speed. They reached Town $$Y$$ at the same time. Find the distance between Town $$X$$ and Town $$Y$$. (Assuming the time taken to refill the petrol was negligible)

In a bag of money to take to the bank I have only $$5\text{p}$$, $$10\text{p}$$ and $$20\text{p}$$ coins. I have twice as many $$20\text{p}$$ coins as $$10\text{p}$$ coins and half as many $$5\text{p}$$ coins as $$10\text{p}$$ coins. If the bag contains £$$15.75$$, haw many $$20\text{p}$$ coins are there?

An orange string is $9.2$ times as long as a purple string. A green string is $24.9\text{cm}$ longer than the purple string. The orange string is $5.52\text{m}$ long. What is the length of the green string? Express your answer in metres.~\uline{~~~~~~~~~~}~$\text{m}$

A rope $$49.5\text{m}$$ long is cut into two pieces. One piece is $$5$$ times as long as the other. Find the length of the longer piece in metres. (Round off your answer to $$1$$ decimal place.)~\uline{~~~~~~~~~~}~$\text{m}$
Find the remainder of $\underbrace{333\ldots333}_{{12  \text{digits} }}\div7$.

A squirrel is jumping from the bottom of a 31-metre tree. It could jump up 3 metres each time, but it would fall 2 metres after every 3 jumps. How many jumps does it take the squirrel to reach the top of the tree?

There were $$64$$ more buttons in box $$\text{A}$$ than box $$\text{B}$$ at first. Ken then added some more buttons in box $$\text{A}$$. For every $$1$$ button he added to box $$\text{A}$$, he removed $$2$$ buttons from box $$\text{B}$$. The number of buttons in box $$\text{B}$$ became $$28$$ fewer than before. In the end, the ratio of the total number of buttons in both boxes to the number of buttons left in box $$\text{B}$$ was $$4:1$$. How many buttons were in box $$\text{A}$$ at first?
A boulevard in a park is 300m long. How many litter bins can be placed on one side of it at 10m intervals, and on both ends? (Ignore the width of the bins.)
Bob the builder takes $$3$$ minutes to cut a log into $$4$$ pieces. How many minutes will he need to cut a log of same size into $$8$$ pieces.

Ahmad and his younger brother studied at the same school. One morning, they walked from home to their school at the same time. The speed of Ahmad and his younger brother was $$80$$ meters per minutes and $$50$$ meters per minutes respectively. When Ahmad reached school, he realized that he forgot to bring his pencil box and he returned home immediately. Ahmad met his younger brother at a distance of $$210$$ meters from school. Find the distance between the school and their home.
A car travels $$550\text{km}$$ in $$5$$ hours. At this speed, in $$3$$ hours, how far will the car travel?
A frog jumps from one post to an adjacent post. Each jump is $$3$$ inches long. How far is it from the 1st post to the 15th post?

($$2015$$ National Mathematical Olympiad of Singapore, Special Round, Question \#$$9$$)\hspace{0pt}\hspace{0pt}  There are $$2$$ inlets (namely $$\text{A}$$ and $$\text{B}$$) in a pool. If only inlet $$\text{A}$$ is open, it takes $$36$$ minutes to fill up the empty pool. If only inlet $$\text{B}$$ is open, it takes $$48$$ minutes to fill up the empty pool. Now, inlets $$\text{A}$$ and $$\text{B}$$ will be open in turns, according to such an order, open inlet $$\text{A}$$ for $$1$$ minute, $$\text{B}$$ for $$2$$ minutes, $$\text{A}$$ for $$2$$ minutes, $$\text{B}$$ for $$1$$ minute, $$\text{A}$$ for $$1$$ minute, $$\text{B}$$ for $$2$$ minutes $$\cdots$$ So on and so forth. How long, in the nearest minutes, does it take to fill up the empty pool?

A weather forecast says,  The probability that it will rain on Saturday is $0.7$.  The probability that it will rain on Sunday is $0.5$.  What is the probability that it will rain at least one day on Saturday and Sunday?

The total weight of Henry, Fred and Richard is $$204.56\text{kg}$$. Richard is $$3.24\text{kg}$$ lighter than Henry. Fred is $$5.6\text{kg}$$ heavier than Richard. What is Fred\textquotesingle s weight?

There are two rectangular swimming pools with the same base and height. If both of two swimming pools start to drain water at the same time, after how many minutes the height of $A$\textquotesingle s waterline will be $3$ times that of $B$?

There were $$18$$ children in a queue.  Counting from front to back, Vanessa was the $${{10}^{\text{th}}}$$ in the queue.  Andrea was the $${{12}^{\text{th}}}$$ counting from the end of the queue.  How many children were between Vanessa and Andrea?
A path is $\frac56$km long. A fence is built along the path for $\frac23$km. What is the distance of the path that is not fenced?
Louise spent $$4$$ hours at home yesterday. Max spent one hour less than Louise at home. Sally spent $$3$$ times the amount of Louise at home. How much time did Sally spend at home?

The area of a triangle is $54\text{cm}^{2}$ and it has a base length of $9\text{cm}$. What is the height of the triangle?~\uline{~~~~~~~~~~}~$\text{cm}$

At Think Olympics, Jack completes an $$800-$$meter race. He runs the first $$280$$ meters at a speed of $$7$$ meters per second, the middle $$400$$ meters at a speed of $$5$$ meters per second, and in the sprint stage, Jack runs at a speed of $$8$$ meters per second. Find the time Jack spends to complete the race (in seconds).

A crew of workers is planting trees on one side of a $$42-$$meter highway every $$7$$ metres apart. If there are no trees planted on both ends of the highway, the workers plant a total of~\uline{~~~~~~~~~~}~trees.
Tie three $$20$$ cm short ruler with rope to form a long ruler. The overlapping part between the two short ruler bundles is $$3$$ cm long. How many centimeters is the length of the bundle?

Every morning, Star goes out to exercise. At $$\rm 6:30$$ a.m., Star leaves home and jogs at a speed of $$6$$ miles per hour. At $$\rm 7:30 $$ a.m., Star feels a little bit tired and walks at a speed of $$5$$ miles per hour. At $$\rm 9:30$$ a.m., Star finishes her exercise. How many miles does Star travel in total every morning?

A vegetable plot is $23$ metres long. Cauliflowers are planted in a row down the length of the plot. They are planted $$15$$ cm apart and the first cauliflower is planted $$20$$ cm away from the start. If a Cauliflower has a width of $$45$$ cm, how many cauliflowers can be planted in the plot?
The speed of sound is about $3.4 \times 10^{2}$ meters per second. How long does it take for sound to travel $1.5$ kilometers?

The golden rabbit and the sea turtle were having a $$6990-$$metre race. They started running at the same time. The golden rabbit ran at a speed of $$330\rm m/\min$$ and the sea turtle ran at a speed of $$30\rm m/\min$$. Ten minutes later, the rabbit felt confident and slept for $$215$$ minutes. Then he woke up and continued running at the same speed. According to the information above, who reached the finish line first? What was the distance between them when the first one reached the finish line?
A twenty-four hour digital watch shows only hours and minutes. How many times each day does the watch show at least two fours simultaneously?

A mouse is trying to climb out of a hole which is $220\text{cm}$~deep.  Each hour, she manages to climb $40\text{cm}$, but slips back $10\text{cm}$~when she stops for a rest.  How many hours will it take her to reach the top of the hole?

Mina put $$11$$ potted plants in a row from one end to the other end of the corridor.  They were placed at an equal distance from one another.  The distance between the first and the last potted plant was $$30 \text{m}$$.  Later, Mina decided to remove $$8$$ potted plants.  As a result, the remaining potted plants were rearranged from one end to the other end of the corridor at a new equal spacing. Find the new interval between each potted plants.

The Road Authority decided to use a new system for traffic lights. The traffic lights are arranged such that $3$ traffic lights turn green at the same time every $9$ minutes. The first traffic light changes lights every half a minute and the second traffic light changes lights every $0.75$ minutes. Determine the shortest possible time the third traffic light takes to change lights, considering that it should be at least $30$ seconds or longer.
How many millimetres are there in $2$ metres?

Jack and Rose depart from Town $$A$$ and Town $$B$$ at the same time respectively, traveling towards each other. Jack travels $$15$$ km per hour, and Rose travels $$10$$ km per hour. They meet each other in $$10$$ hours. What is the distance between Town $A$ and Town $B$?
If you choose any point in an isosceles right triangle with a waist length of $2 $, what is the probability that the distance between this point and the right angle vertex is less than $1 $?

Hannah left school at $$15:22$$. She walked to the bus stop and just caught the bus at $$16:01$$. The bus trip took $$18$$ minutes. She then walked home from the bus drop off point, eventually getting in at $$16:35$$.  How long did Hannah spend walking altogether?
Samantha has a ribbon that measures 150 cm. She cuts it in half.  How long is each piece in metres?

Peter jogged from home to his friend\textquotesingle s house. At $$8.00$$ am, he was $$6300\rm m$$ away from his friend\textquotesingle s house. At $$8.30$$ am, he was $$1800\rm m$$ away. At what time did he reach his friend\textquotesingle s house?

A comb for horses has $$100$$ teeth (the width of the teeth are negligible). The distance between the $$4$$\textsuperscript{th}~teeth and the $$9$$\textsuperscript{th}~teeth is $30$ mm. How long is the comb in centimetres?
Hook walks $20$ minutes to school, and he walks $5$ more minutes than Lily. How many minutes does Lily walk?

Lucas and his mother depart from two places $$20$$ miles apart at the same time walking towards each other. The ratio of the speeds of Lucas to his mother is $3:5$. After a while, the distance between them is $$4$$ miles. How far does Lucas walk when they are $$4$$ miles apart?
Four lamp posts are in a straight line. The distance from each post to the next is $$25\text{m}$$. What is the distance from the first post to the last?

If Ben cycles from Town $$A$$ to Town $$B$$ at a speed of $$10\rm km/h$$, he will arrive at $$10$$ am. If he travels at $$15\rm km/h$$, he will arrive at $$8$$ am. At what speed must he cycle to arrive at $$9$$ am?
Raj is $138  \text{cm}$~tall and David is $170  \text{cm}$~tall. Jacob is half way between Raj's and David's height. Work out Jacob's height.

During a $5$-km race, $9$ marshals are spread out in equal intervals along the route from the starting line to the finishing line. What is the distance between $2$ marshals? Give your answer in metres.

Bob bikes from his home to a cinema. He bikes at a speed of $180$ meters per minute for $6$ minutes. Then he feels tired and bikes at a speed of $120$ meters per minute for $8$ minutes and he arrives at the cinema. What is the distance between Bob\textquotesingle s home and the cinema in meters?
Given that $\frac37=\dot{4}2857\dot{1}$. Find the $69\text{th}$ digit after the decimal point in the decimal form of $\frac{3}{7}$.

Dylan has $300$ grams of a solution with a salt concentration of $35 \%$ and Daisy has $200$ grams of a solution with a salt concentration of $50 \%$. They mixed the solutions together. What is the concentration of the resulting salt solution?
How many centimetres are there in $$212.4$$ metres?

Betty and Kevin finish watching a movie in the cinema and want to go home. Betty leaves earlier than Kevin and arrives at a grocery store in $$6$$ minutes. At this time, Kevin has walked $$150$$ metres. If both continue walking for another $$3$$ minutes at their previous speeds, Kevin will arrive at the store, and Betty will be $$900$$ metres away from the cinema. Find how many minutes earlier Betty leaves than Kevin does.
